results.title: Oliver (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Columbia, Warwick, Romulus Films, John Wolf and Carol Reed
results.brief_description: Perhaps the best loved of all family pictures, “Oliver” is a joyous and entertaining version of Dickens’ “Oliver Twist”. Mark Lester plays Oliver, the foundling who escapes the indignities of the workhouse to find success and happiness in the London underworld. Oliver’s new friends include the Artful Dodger and Fagin who teach him to “pick a pocket”. Star roles are played by Harry Secombe, Oliver Reed and Shani Wallis.

results.title: Office killer
results.creator_credit: Artfear Productions, Christine Vachon, Pamela Koffler and Cindy Sherman
results.brief_description: Usually known for her extensive career in photography spanning over 20 years, Cindy Sherman directs her first feature film and brings to life the characters that she has depicted within her photography. Dorine (Kane) is the company doormat, seemingly obliging and mild mannered until one day she accidentally electrocutes a fellow worker, who happens to be her most obnoxious opponent. The unhinged Dorine continues her killing spree believing that all can be friends when dead. Her antics verge on discovery when the bitchy co-worker played by Molly Ringwald suspects that all is not okay. Following in the b-grade genre of film-making, Sherman delights with an excess of gory special effects. Cast also includes: Jeanne Tripplehorn.

results.title: Of mice and men
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Russ Smith and Gary Sinise
results.brief_description: John Malkovich and Gary Sinise both deliver powerhouse performances in this adaptation of John Steinbeck’s classic tale of doomed friendship set in the Great Depression. Best friends Lennie (Malkovich) and George (Sinise) find themselves unemployed and unable to keep stable employment for long, due to Lennie’s infantile mental capacity. Their luck seems to change as they are hired at the Tyler Ranch, although they must endure the over-zealous supervision by the boss’s son, Curley (Casey Siemaszko). After settling in and making friends, their world is torn asunder by tragedy when Curley’s unhappy wife (Sherilyn Fenn) becomes the innocent victim of Lennie’s compassion.

results.title: Oedipus Rex = Edipo Re
results.brief_description: A son’s loving obsession with his mother turns to patricide and incest in this intricate exploration of what Freud has termed “the Oedipus complex.” Pasolini’s powerful adaptation of Sophocles’ play is a unique voyage of psychological discovery which blends the director’s personal history with the timeless themes of mythology. Filmed amidst the atmospheric setting of the Moroccan desert and modern Bologna, “Oedipus Rex” is a startling visual achievement, boasting an extraordinary central performance by Franco Citti as the tortured Oedipus.

results.title: October sky
results.creator_credit: Universal Pictures, Larry Franco, Charles Gordon and Joe Johnston
results.brief_description: NASA engineer Homer J. Hickman, Jr’s autobiography provided the basis for this drama about a teenager coming of age at the dawn of the space race. In 1957, Homer Hickman (Jake Gyllenhaal) is a high school student in Coalwood, West Virginia, where coal mining is the only career path open to young people in the town. When news of the launch of the Soviet spaceship Sputnik breaks, most of the townsfolk react with fear or disgust, not Homer who is instantly fascinated and becomes obsessed with jet and rocket design. With the help of his three friends and teacher (Laura Dern), Homer sets out to build his own rocket. Despite his father’s (Chris Cooper) disapproval, a limited education and a series of misfires that threaten to flatten his dreams and the town, Homer overcomes the odds to realise his dreams. This is a story that mixes the drama of traditional family conflicts with a nostalgic glimpse of life in mid-50s America, as well as providing a look at the earliest days of our journey into space. Based on the book “Rocket boys” by Homer J. Hickman, Jr.

results.title: Ocean's eleven
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Village Roadshow Pictures, NPV Entertainment, Jerry Weintraub and Steven Soderbergh
results.brief_description: Soderbergh followed up his Oscar winning film “Traffic” with “Ocean’s eleven” - a remake of the 1960 Rat Pack film (starring Sinatra, Dean Martin et al) of the same name. Like the original, the plot is a daring heist of several casinos in one grand night. Danny Ocean takes the lead role of the film as the gang chief and mastermind of the scheme. His unruly crew consist of Rusty (best buddy), Reuben (moneyman), Frank (croupier), Linus (pickpocket), Saul (aging con artist), Basher (explosives expert), Dell (technical expert), Virgil and Turk (two daft brothers providing comic relief) and Yen (acrobat). Ocean fails to tell the crew that his target (and motive) is to sting the new boyfriend of his ex-wife and owner of the casinos that will be hit. Soderbergh plays “Ocean’s eleven” largely for laughs, rather than with any tension typical of a caper film and with a touch of romance thrown in for good measure. Great care is taken to display the technical complexity of the job and dexterity of the crew, with much of the film devoted to the set-up. “Ocean’s eleven” has a cool, smooth engaging rhythm that prioritises aesthetics over any sense of real characterisation.

results.title: Ocean's eleven
results.creator_credit: Dorchester, Warner Bros Pictures and Lewis Milestone
results.brief_description: Danny Ocean (Frank Sinatra) gathers together a group of ex-army buddies for an ambitious heist - the robbery of several casinos on New Year’s eve. His gang include playboy Jimmy (Peter Lawler), lounge lizard Sam (Dean Martin) and garbage man Josh (Sammy Davis Jnr) among others. At the time of production these very actors made up the crew known as the Rat Pack. Led by Sinatra, the Rat Pack were infamous for their carousing, womanising, drinking, entertaining and swinging image and in this film they do not stray far from their real life personas. “Ocean’s eleven” is not a film that treats the heist genre seriously in that it lacks any real tension of great films of that type. Rather, the film’s joys are derived from its 1960s aesthetic, the machinations of the sartorial Rat Pack at play, and the musical numbers courtesy of Davis and Martin. Also stars: Angie Dickinson , Cesar Romero, Shirley MacLaine, Joey Bishop and Red Skelton.

results.title: Objective Burma
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Jerry Wald and Raoul Walsh
results.brief_description: Acknowledged as one of the best war films to come out of Hollywood, ‘Objective Burma’ follows the plight of a group of paratroopers dropped into the Burmese jungle to wipe out a Japanese radar station - they are led by Captain Nelson (Errol Flynn). With their mission successfully completed, their arduous journey has only just begun when they are attacked by the Japanese and are unable to be picked up by the rescue plane. Thus begins a harrowing trek to freedom through jungles and swamps where the troops are faced with natural perils, internal demons, as well as enemy soldiers. From an original story by Alvah Bessie. Cast also includes James Brown, William Prince, George Tobias, Henry Hull and Warner Anderson. The film was lauded in the United States but blasted in the British press for minimizing the efforts of British troops in Burma. This led to the film being banned in Britain until 1952, and was only re-released after this with a pacifying prologue extolling British involvement in the campaign.

results.title: O' Lucky man
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Memorial, Sam, Lindsay Anderson and Michael Medwin
results.brief_description: Director Lindsay Anderson delivers a film that consciously plays with the telling of a story, beginning with sepia tone and the opening line ‘Once Upon a Time’. From then on we’re launched into technicolour and taken on the surreal journey of an ambitious young man in search of success who is constantly thwarted by the British Establishment. Mick Travis (Malcolm McDowell), a trainee coffee salesman, is both optimistic and naive. With his desire to be successful he eagerly jumps at any opportunity with wilful ignorance that inevitably leads him into the path of sinister digressions that challenge his good intentions. Each vignette plays on the genres of film from horror to comedy, realism to surrealism. The actors deftly play several roles each, their characters weave in and out of the story line to occasionally reconnect in this sprawling celebration of allegory.

results.title: Nurse Betty [DVD]
results.creator_credit: IMF (DE), Propaganda Films, AB'-Strakt Pictures, Universal Pictures, Steve Golin, Gail Mutrux and Neil LaBute
results.brief_description: Nurse Betty is a black comedy directed by Neil LaBute (In the company of men, Your friends and neighbours). Renee Zellweger (Bridget Jones’s diary) stars as Betty Sizemore, a big-hearted waitress living in Fair Oakes, Kansas with her boorish, abusive, cheating husband Del (Aaron Eckhart). Unbeknownst to Betty, Del is involved in some shady business dealings. One night when Betty is engrossed in her favourite soap, “A Reason to love”, Del is crudely murdered by two hit men, Wesley (Chris Rock) and Charlie (Morgan Freeman). Rather than believe reality, Betty believes the screen and goes off in search of her long lost love ‘Dr David Ravell’, the main character on her favourite show. The two hit men who killed her husband, each of whom make very different assumptions about their prey, pursue Betty across country. Once in LA, Betty strikes up a friendship with Rosa (Tia Texada) who reluctantly helps her track down her mythical doctor, played by Greg Kinnear. Renee Zellweger is funny and convincing as the naive, Betty, and won Best Actress in a comedy/musical at the Golden Globes, 2001.
